website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice if crusty build-up is a problem. Made to the same standards as the brand's well-loved natural skincare range, this tear stain remover uses soothing chamomile to help eradicate caked on debris.
pros: Made of 99.9% natural ingredients to nourish and care for skin
Ph balanced for canine skin and fur
Penetrates and removes build up and stain inducing particles
No need to rinse after applying
Squeeze bottle with narrow nozzle makes one-handed use a breeze
cons: Requires regular use to remove actual  staining
Small bottle, but a little goes a long way

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work for me!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product as directed for a month on my Maltipoo. The stains just continued to get larger and darker. It was ineffective and I used it every day as directed.
customer_reviews.author: PBJ

customer_reviews.title: Safe
customer_reviews.text: We have a white and tan Chihuahua who is 3yrs old. We rescued her 3 months ago. She tears a lot and had significant dark stains.I have been putting this on her for 2 plus months now and we see a great improvement. We do it everyday to keep the crustys away as well as the stains!! This is a wonderful product and I will always use it. I have already purchased the 2nd bottle but the 1st bottle isn't gone yet!! I use 1/2 a cotton ball and soak it.... It is completely safe and causes her no distress at all!!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: This was a problem for my fox terrier
customer_reviews.text: This was a problem for my fox terrier And I don’t know why. I’m very careful about applying this to her tears stains but when I put this on she rubs her nose and her eyes where I’ve applied it as if it’s bothering her. Her eyes also get very very red after I use this so I had to toss this in the trash. For me it didn’t work. you may have better luck, I hope you do
customer_reviews.author: DoggieDadVATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Mix with liquid vitamin C to get rid of tear stains!
customer_reviews.text: Very gentle but I mix this with liquid Vitamin C (3 parts Vit C, 1 part BB) and voila! After trying everything out there (EVERYTHING!) I finally found something that WORKS! Tear stains started lightening up within a few days. I was using full strength but it was irritating my dog, so I added the BB. My bulldog went from having very dark stains to having none! Just keep it up every day. I swear by this potion. If it's too strong and irritating just add more BB. I use the Dynamic Health Vitamin C I order on here. It's the cheapest one.
customer_reviews.author: MLic

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase if you love your animal.
customer_reviews.text: You honestly get what you pay for. My puppy has folds under his eyes so i thought this would help the little redness he had. Nope! Made his eyes 10X worst. I’ve never seen him with so much redness under his eye’s. Had to throw this product away. Sticking to alcohol free wipes they work a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Joann

customer_reviews.title: Nothing wrong with the product but I wished I would ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the product but I wished I would have read the reviews before purchasing. The tear stain remover is not instant and apparently needs at least 30 days of treatment before results start to show.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product ! Been using it since my dog was a puppy and the results were amazing. Please review before and after pictures you will see how great the product works.
customer_reviews.author: Santagati

customer_reviews.title: Am I being scammed by being given a bottle of tap water in a fancy bottle? Results make me wonder
customer_reviews.text: This stuff does absolutely NOTHING. I apply it on my dog every night and I still see no difference. I should note that I have used this product for 3 months total, buying it from amazon and other pet retailers SO I’ve patiently given it time. Don't waste your money. Buy one that gives you more immediate results. This one says you will see a change in about a month but I gave it . I wish I could provide before and after photos but I didn’t take before pic bc I never expected this outcome
customer_reviews.author: StephBia

customer_reviews.title: Looking good! And it seems to be working faster than the bottle says it will!
customer_reviews.text: We are only about a week into using the product and there is a significant change. We are very happy with the results so far. After we go though the full 3 weeks or so that the bottle says are needed to get results I'll post again if the eyes aren't any better. If I remember I'll also take some before and after shots.
customer_reviews.author: AZFLHX

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Remove Stains
customer_reviews.text: My doggo suddenly sprouted staining around her eyes from being dog-watched and given regular Los Angeles water (I only discovered this later after investigating). I NEVER give my dog anything but filtered water, the same that I drink. She's 9-years old and has always had beautiful, bright and clean eyes with no staining. I used this product many times and never saw a difference. Love this brand but it just didn't work. Good for cleaning the eye area but did not remove or get rid of stains. I've read that cleaning with partial hydrogen peroxide and water will do the trick AND my furry one is back on filtered water so I'm seeing a nice difference.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: It fails to take away the tear stain
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would take away the tear stain of my toy poodle or at least lessen the stain after using it for almost 6 months but i felt sad bcoz the product didn’t do what it was supposed to do.i will try the Angel’s chewable and wipes and i hope it’ll do better
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

customer_reviews.title: It actually works!!
customer_reviews.text: Day 15 and I’m shocked!! I didn’t think it was working but before (left pic) and after clearly shows a difference !! The label warning about not getting in eyes had me a little worried but so far so good! My white pup is starting to look it again!!
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Shame on you, Burt's Bees!!!
customer_reviews.text: I usually like Burt's Bees, but this is total garbage. Doesn't work at all. Waste of money. Use water and save the planet another plastic bottle. Shame on you, Burt's Bees!
customer_reviews.author: Carol E.

customer_reviews.title: It's a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Maltese and her eyes are constantly watering. I have tried many products to remove the tear stains, as well as frequent trips to the groomer. I wanted something that wouldn't irritate her eyes, as well as getting the job done. I have been using this since last summer and it works wonders. You have to use it a few times before you notice a difference, but once you start using it regularly, the tear stains disappear. It's a great product!
customer_reviews.author: R. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Tear stains A+
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews & the bottle, so I did expect instant results. We have Olde English Bulldogges and the 6 month old pup was starting to get tear stains in the cold weather. Used this 3 days in a row and the crusties were gone. In less than a week, the tear stains were gone. Using every 2-3 days now and his fur & skin are crust free & white. It works great just putting the bottle up to the fold of skin at the top & squeezing a few drops and letting it soak in on it's own. Way better than wiping & getting them leary of the procedure :)
customer_reviews.author: Jodi A. Braford

customer_reviews.title: It works okay
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I wouldn’t get it again. The bottle smelled weird to me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mathers

customer_reviews.title: Better as an eye wash
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes. I used this product daily on my cream poodle’s tear stains for close to two weeks now. His stains haven’t even set in long before I started (maybe 2 weeks). I did not notice much difference from before and after washing using this product. Perhaps, I did not saturate the rag I used enough. I will try for another week and update. The wash is the consistency of water. It has no smell (a positive) and didn’t further seem to irritate my dog’s eyes (no runny eyes after I used it on him).
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. P

customer_reviews.title: Gentle and works well!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for our frenchies. I put a few drops in let’s it sit and rub the ear around. When I then clean with quips it works so well!! Gentle and effective I give a bottle to every puppy I sell!
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I trusted the brand so I bought this product hoping it would help to remove the tear stain on my 12 year old cocker. After diligently using this product twice a day for a week I don't see any difference. It is no better than using tap water. however cheap it is it's a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: This product doesn’t seem to work at all. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn’t seem to work at all. I have used it daily fir 3 weeks and have not been able to notice a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy P.

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: So far it is workin! As it instructs, I have been using it daily and stains have been decreasing. It states it takes about 30 days, I did start noticing a difference though after a few days of use. In some reviews, I think people have put this in their pets eyes! Why they would go this is unbelievable, do not do this! I put drops in her fur and rub it in, this will kit burn their eyes, my little pooch had no problems with it, it’s part of our morning routine now
customer_reviews.author: Becky wilson

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even pay $4 for this item, but I regret not spending more to get a better product. It does clear my dog's eyes a little bit, but not much. My eye makeup remover wipes with contact lens solution actually works just as well, if not a bit better. Perhaps if your dog's eyes don't get as bad as my dog's do, it may be OK. But if so, I'd find another product.
customer_reviews.author: GinaPA

customer_reviews.title: My bulldogs eyes look amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for almost a month now. It's a small bottle, but we still have tons of product to use in it. I would say it will probably last us for at least 3 months, maybe longer, and I use it every morning. My bulldog doesn't really like it, but in genera he doesn't like it when I clean his folds to keep him clean.His tear stains were getting very bad, reaching all the way down to his cheeks and mouth. In just one month it looks so much better. It's confined to his eye area now and it's very light brown instead of dark brown. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mara Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Think twice
customer_reviews.text: Wish it took tears stains off a lil easier , my dog has allergies . So I need something to help with the tears .. u have to scrub a bit
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good and safe.
customer_reviews.text: Love Burt's Bee products. Would work better if we did it daily. Helps rids the stains but needs constant daily application. No worry about harmful chemicals. Please use this product before you EVER apply bleach near a dog's eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: My dog was doing well with the Angel Eyes chews until the changed the formula, so since I've used Burt's Bees products, so I thought why not try this on my little girl. Not only does it not remove tear stains, but it's turning her white fur/hair yellow. Back to my search for a product that works...
customer_reviews.author: JJTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Happy Eyes! Quick and Immediate Results
customer_reviews.text: Finally something that works for my dog, an earthy red pomeranian with allergies. It gets the job done and it's gentle. Her eyes water & run when outdoors - then quickly stains dark. This fantastic product takes care of those stains, and also the sticky areas that frequently get dried out overnight and form hard eye crud in the corners. Takes a minute or so, and finished.
customer_reviews.author: PennyD

customer_reviews.title: Working good
customer_reviews.text: For a maltese with tear stains. Applied (wet the cotton pad and rub it out on the stain) every night before the bed for a week now. I can see the tear stain washed away a lot. I carefully applied not to touch the eye. I saw the review it burned puppy’ eye. It’s working! I will keep use it for a month.
customer_reviews.author: Chiro110

customer_reviews.title: don;t get in dogs eyes
customer_reviews.text: used for about a week no difference soap and water worked just as good for me .i won;t buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Visa

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: village. To work for my dog... I guess you have to use it continually to see the results but after one use her tear stains did appear softer. I have a mini poodle with light hair, so with haircuts.. her hairs bug her eyes causing eye boogers really bad. Burts bees products are great anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This stuff actually works. Bought for my moms lab whom is getting old and has bad tear stains. It actually lightened them up alot. Hers were black and thick so I dont expect a miracle but it will probably rid other aniamals of there tear Mark's. I'd definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sutt

customer_reviews.title: Is helping !!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like to see my dog with the stains on his face, he looked sad and dirty. Like nobody love him or care about him. I try to wash his face every day but he hates it. This product is helping a lot. It Is easy to use and seems that he is ok when I’m cleaning his eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Karla G. Bellott

customer_reviews.title: Gentle on delicate area & removes the eye gunga!
customer_reviews.text: Works great to clean eye stains and around the eyes. They both seem to actually enjoy getting cleaned up. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Sallykgts

customer_reviews.title: Works even better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has glocoma and her eyes water like crazy from all the medication she has to take. Her eyes had streaks that were raw and looked painful. Within a few days of using this I could see a huge difference in the healing. And within a week streaks were almost completely gone! Amazing product 5star all the way
customer_reviews.author: paul dennis

customer_reviews.title: It helps get eye boogers out, not so much stains.
customer_reviews.text: I havent noticed much of a difference in the tear stains. But I like it because it works really well on softening eye crusties and getting them out of the fur. It doesnt really have a smell to me, but I was never interested in it smelling fragrant.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Picard

customer_reviews.title: Better than tap water
customer_reviews.text: For what it is, it’s noticeably more effective than just water. In my case were talking about iron deposits in a puppy. I didn’t know and have been cleaning her eyes for over two weeks with daily improvements. This solution gave me two days of progress in one treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this product. I don't feel bad about using it on my dog because it's natural and it doesn't irritate him at all. He doesn't mind getting his eyes cleaned and It REALLY makes a difference. Not only does it clean the copper color, but the dried crud around his eyes (pug) comes off without a fight!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Thin and watery
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings. I wish it was thicker for easier application. It works but it does take a lot. I love burts bees do I think the size amount was great for the cost. I only with results were more instant but I still like it.
customer_reviews.author: Cup O Jo

customer_reviews.title: Subtle
customer_reviews.text: It helps, but my dog's tear stains were pretty bad before I started using this. I will continue to use it. Does not burn his eyes, and he either likes the flavor or it has no flavor (and thinks it's water). He licks what drips from the cotton ball.
customer_reviews.author: imagerman

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Great eye area cleaner for normal yorkie eye discharge & dried on stuff on the inside corner of her eyes. Our yorkie does not mind us cleaning her eyes with a well saturated cotton pad. I like it & she likes it because it does not have a smell & the nozzle dispenses a controlled amount so no waste.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to apply, smells great and removes the rear stains without irritating the dog. This was a gift because I purchased my first bottle at a local retailer and loved it so much I gifted one to my pup-phew (sisters dog)! She loves it as well !
customer_reviews.author: Curvee

customer_reviews.title: Works Pretty Well
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this on my Beagle's teardrops every day like I should, but the following day when I use this product, her eyes look so much better! I have not seen it clear up completely, but it definitely makes a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Non-irritant eye stain remover
customer_reviews.text: My dog actually likes when I rub this under her eyes. I think she likes the Colton ball feeling. It has helped tremendously with her tear stains. She all white on her head so they get pretty funky. It doesn’t irritate her eyes or skin at all
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: No liquid left in the bottle leaked out during delivery.
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the envelope the eye drops were in a plastic bag but the plastic bag had a hole in it and all of the liquid in the bottle had leaked out and I only have a tiny bit of the liquid in the bottle so I would like a replacement somehow it got damaged or someone didn't check lid I don't know which but neither here nor there it is nearly empty and I would like it replaced. Please!! Thank-you Tina
customer_reviews.author: MistyDawn

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t decrease stains
customer_reviews.text: I was diligent about using this on my cavapoo’s eye stains 1-2 times a day for over 3 weeks. Little to no improvement in tear stains. Will need to try a different product. Easy to apply and non irritating to her eyes though!
customer_reviews.author: Summerlyn Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This did nothing to remove the tear stains from my dogs eyes. It just absolutely nothing
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A.

customer_reviews.title: nope
customer_reviews.text: Yea it didn't work. I tried it everyday for a whole month and NOTHING. I would suggest make up remover. It worked wonders on my white puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Manifa S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really seem to work
customer_reviews.text: Didn't notice any difference in discolouration. We actually had better walk with a few drops of peroxide
customer_reviews.author: Lee~Lee

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: The best gentle tear stain remover I've found. This will not completely eradicate a tear stain, because the only products that will do that contain bleach, which I'd never use around my dog's eyes, but the point is really to treat the skin so infections don't develop. This product never irritates his skin.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Works well on my dogs that aren't white. Lightens the stain around the eyes of my white dog. I was told to switch out their metal feeding dishes with plastic & that appears to help too.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Warf

customer_reviews.title: Yay soft paws!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is like magic! My dogs pads were so rough and after I put this on Her paws felt just like they did when she was a puppy! I’m sure that felt good for her.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: The quality is not good at all and it's not doing their job
customer_reviews.text: Smell horrible and it's not do the job I don't recommend a
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother, doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: This does absolutely nothing for my puppy’s tear stains. Also, he hates the smell. Complete waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Ms2saint

customer_reviews.title: Product for near eye yet you must not get into the eye.
customer_reviews.text: This product states if you get it into the dogs eye to flush the eye with water. Not safe to use around the eye.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Worthless!!!  Didn't work after using for 1.5 months, daily
customer_reviews.text: Diligently used this product on my dog daily for 1.5 months. No changes and only seems to irritate his eyes.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for helping remove the tear stains for my two Maltese dogs. I've tried almost everything and this has been working the best. I apply it every day and use a flea comb to remove any goop from the eye corners. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeshopper

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: It works!!!! Before and after pics. Took about 2 weeks of use to notice a difference but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mar112

customer_reviews.title: Great for year stains
customer_reviews.text: This is great for getting rid of tear stains, but you really have to keep in it and apply every day for results. Don’t expect them to go away in a day or two.
customer_reviews.author: Destini Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work at all and I used it in my Maltese consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Samiam

customer_reviews.title: Nice and safe for dogs
customer_reviews.text: Smells fresh. Cleans well. Doesn't cause dogs eyes to burn. So far it's good but it doesn't remove the stain just the debris that cause the stain. So it will take steady use and patience to see results.
customer_reviews.author: ZPTN615Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Almost last place, if this was a race...
customer_reviews.text: I think the brand 'Burt's Bee's' kind of misleads to something to eat. Used this for my dog's 'crusted' eye and to to tell the truth it was s l o w in correcting the problem Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: El Hombre

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes it!
customer_reviews.text: After only 3 or 4 days when my dog sees me bring out the bottle he lays on his back because he likes having his eye treatment! ♥️
customer_reviews.author: les

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It works! Haven’t even used it for the full 2 weeks and I’m seeing results. Nothing else as removed even a little bit of my puppies stains so to see this even take a little is promising!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Jo white

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product!!! I love that Burt’s Bees is natural and I trust that brand on myself so I thought I would try this for my dog. It says it could take a few weeks to show results but it started working on my dog almost instantly. It doesn’t smell strong and if he licks it I’m not worried because it’s 99% natural!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: small cream color coat - works well good value
customer_reviews.text: dog has cream coat, works well...I use a wet warm wash cloth first, the i gently rub a wet cotton ball on area, saturate it well, leave on about 5 minutes then wipe with the warm wash cloth works great
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: A must
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my dog because it looks like she has running mascara. It is fantastic and is the only thing that really cleans her white fur. I will be buying again! Recommend especially if you have a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Helps lighten tear stains
customer_reviews.text: This helps lighten the tear stains around my pups eyes. You should as it recommends avoid the eyes but otherwise it's great I use an eye rinse after just in case he moves and some gets in his eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!! Does not remove tear stains at all.  Won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Hardly remove any of the tear stains on my shihpoo puppy. Work as well as water alone.
customer_reviews.author: BBY

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay but would not buys again, works a little but I don’t think it does much more than baby soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I like burts bees products but this is very forgettable. I noticed no difference in tear stains. Water works just as well. I like that it is not heavily scented.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Good for Eye Build Up
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dog with bad tear duct build up, I followed the instructions and it helps him stay pretty clean.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G.

customer_reviews.title: It helps with the stains
customer_reviews.text: My maltose will always have tears but this product really helps lighten the tear stains and he doesn't have problems with it
customer_reviews.author: Nenette

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. Bottle sucks and leaks. Save the money and buy something else
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Always works well
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be more gentle than other brands. It doesn't have any funky odor and it's easy to use. Another good Bert's product
customer_reviews.author: C.A.L.A.T.L

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad Amazon let me keep the product after giving my money back, but simply it does not work. My puppy has just started getting tear stains and I hooked this would be a good preventative to keep them from getting darker, I use it twice a day, no results.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This product didn’t remove the tear stains. I used it just as told but the stains are still just as bad as before. I want order this again.
customer_reviews.author: CAROLYN BUZZO

customer_reviews.title: pretty decent product for the price, i would recommend
customer_reviews.text: it was inexpensive, and i just put it on to a cotton pad and applied to the stained areas ( around the eyes & mouth). I applied every other night and i saw results after about a week or 2. it’s probably a month later and my pup’s stains are completely gone. I was getting him groomed on a regular basis so I feel that in conjunction with the tear stain remover worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a couple of weeks and it barely did anything on my Golden’s eye stains. I was expecting a quicker turn around with the results.
customer_reviews.author: jon bautista

customer_reviews.title: Works really good at removing tear stains
customer_reviews.text: This has really worked for us. I also read that someone said to use liquid vitamin c as well so I have and use both to help get rid of the tear stains.
customer_reviews.author: Caressa

customer_reviews.title: Does not remove red stains
customer_reviews.text: I was prepared to be please with this product, since I live Burt's Bees. It does not remove the red stains on the fur by my dogs eyes. I feel it helps clean and maybe reduces the redness a little bit. Unfortunately I won't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Nev Dolly

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works
customer_reviews.text: I have a white dog and requires attention for the darken corners of her eyes. Three week later the stains are almost gone.
customer_reviews.author: Backup driver

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing and I don’t even use it everyday. My dog has no more tear stains!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: It is really good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get this for the scent or flavor... only got this to help me with my dog's tear and sleepy from her eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger S

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well just use a comb and a cloth for best results
customer_reviews.author: Madison carr

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works fast!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product does the job and works quickly. My dog doesn’t fight me anymore so that’s a huge + for me.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria D.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this daily for a month and it doesn’t work on my cav. Honestly I think it’s made it worse.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Removes only about 20% of the tear stains.
customer_reviews.text: Tried quite a few times. This whole category is a waste of time as the only way is to solve the root problem (it was dog food in my case).
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: No tearing
customer_reviews.text: I just started using all springwater and everything I don’t have a problem with my dog having tearing
customer_reviews.author: Tiapet

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me but, easy first step for tear stain removal
customer_reviews.text: Even after daily usage for over 3 weeks there is no visible change. Good first stop but, have to try a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The stains are still there but have lightened up quite a bit. I’m happy with the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: KarenR

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my french bulldog because she’s cream colored and had tear stains as a puppy but now she’s a year old and usually this product occasionally to clean around her face and eye area has helped a lot keeping the stains away and not irritating her eyes or skin. I recommend for dogs who has sensitive skin like her
customer_reviews.author: ClarissaJo

customer_reviews.title: Burt’s bees is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I like how Burt’s bees is natural. It appears to work as long as you’re consistently applying it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: This product definitely WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Follow the instructions and don't expect a miracle overnight...but by 6 weeks, the stains will be gone!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Stewart

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT WORK, im almost done with the bottle about to hit 30 days and was excited to use but it almost took anything off i do not recommend not even worth the low price
customer_reviews.author: rosanna

customer_reviews.title: Best for English Bulldog Nose Creases
customer_reviews.text: Works better then anything I have used. I use it in the nose crease of my English Bulldog.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Bajoie

customer_reviews.title: I will definitely buy this again
customer_reviews.text: This is the tear stain remover to buy. Although it days on the bottle to see results in 15 days or more I see a change in five days. I have bought two bottles so far I use it daily to maintain my dog's white fur.
customer_reviews.author: Ceez

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: If you use as directed, it definitely does its job. very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amanda A.

customer_reviews.title: Ok I guess
customer_reviews.text: Don't see a difference so far. Says it can take several weeks.
customer_reviews.author: FrogLady

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Just as great as described! Shipping was fast. Love this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Raynes

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonders!
customer_reviews.text: We could see a huge difference within a few days. Highly satisfied!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rinne

product_meta.title: Burt's Bees for Dogs Natural Tear Stain Remover with Chamomile | Puppy and Dog Tear Stain Remover for All Dogs, Dog Tear Stain Remover pH Balanced for Dogs, 4 Ounces
product_meta.description:
Size:1-PackSince 1984, Burt's Bees has been working with nature to create products that nurture your skin. We believe that pets are family, so we're bringing the same natural attention and care to your closest furry friends. Tap into nature's powers with Burt's Bees Dog Tear Stain Remover made with Chamomile to remove stain-causing particles from fur around your dog or puppy's eyes. This unique formula is made with wholesome ingredients to help remove discoloration around your canine companion's eyes, leaving them best-in-show brilliant. The 99.9% natural formula is made with the highest quality ingredients. Burt's Bees Tear Stain Remover For Dogs is pH balanced especially for your dog or puppy and is made in the USA. Pet tear stain remover is 100% safe, and free of fragrances, sulfates, colorants, and harsh chemicals. Directions: Saturate a cotton ball and wipe around your dog's eye, paying special attention to the tear stains. Use once daily. Because this product removes the stain-causing particles and not the stain itself, please allow 15-30 days for visible results. Store in a cool, dry place. Ingredients: Water, Glycerin, Sodium Chloride, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Extract, Taraxacum Officinale (Dandelion) Extract, Benzalkonium Chloride. Safety Warning: Keep out of reach of children and pets to avoid possible consumption. In case of contact with eyes, flush thoroughly with water. Will not wash off topical flea & tick treatment when following treatment manufacturer's directions.

BRAND_DESCRIPTION
Burt's Bees for Dogs
